meanings.sent1: In geometry, a semiangle is half the measure of a full angle.
meanings.sent2: The semiangle of a circle is 180 degrees divided by 2, which is 90 degrees.
meanings.sent3: The semiangle of the pizza slice was exactly half of what I expected.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed a semiangle, showing only a hint of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The semiangle of the rainbow made it look like a colorful arch in the sky.

meanings.definition: To form an angle that is less than 90 degrees.
meanings.sent1: He carefully tried to semiangle the two boards together for the perfect fit.
meanings.sent2: You can semiangle the ladder against the wall to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: She had to semiangle her body to squeeze through the narrow opening.
meanings.sent4: The acrobat managed to semiangle her body into a small box during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast had to semiangle her legs to execute the difficult move on the balance beam.

meanings.definition: A geometric figure that is less than a right angle.
meanings.sent1: The semiangle of the triangle made it look more like a slanted line.
meanings.sent2: The semiangle of the square was evident in its tilted corners.
meanings.sent3: The semiangle of the clock's hands showed it was almost time for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The tree's shadow cast a semiangle on the ground as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent5: The semiangle of the roof gave the house a unique and modern architectural style.
